title: Gauss' Lemma
content: Gauss' Lemma is valid for any integer not dividing the given prime number. In the following, only the special case for 2 (not dividing any odd prime) is proven, see ~ gausslemma2d . The general case is still to prove.

thm gausslemma2dlem0b(class c0, class c1, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wcel(c0, cn))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, cdif(cprime, csn(nat2))))
  -| wceq(c0, co(co(c1, cmin, nat1), cdiv, nat2))
} = {
  syl5eqel(c0, cn, co(co(c1, cmin, nat1), cdiv, nat2), w0)
  syl(w0, wcel(co(co(c1, cmin, nat1), cdiv, nat2), cn), wa(wcel(c1, cfv(cuz, nat2)), wcel(co(co(c1, caddc, nat1), cdiv, nat2), cn0)))
  syl(w0, wa(wcel(c1, cfv(cuz, nat2)), wcel(co(co(c1, caddc, nat1), cdiv, nat2), cn0)), wcel(c1, cdif(cprime, csn(nat2))))
  jca(wcel(c1, cdif(cprime, csn(nat2))), wcel(c1, cfv(cuz, nat2)), wcel(co(co(c1, caddc, nat1), cdiv, nat2), cn0))
  syl(wcel(c1, cdif(cprime, csn(nat2))), wcel(c1, cfv(cuz, nat2)), wcel(c1, cprime))
  eldifi(c1, cprime, csn(nat2))
  prmuz2(c1)
  syl(wcel(c1, cdif(cprime, csn(nat2))), wcel(co(co(c1, caddc, nat1), cdiv, nat2), cn0), wa(wcel(c1, cn), wn(wbr(nat2, cdvds, c1))))
  nnoddn2prm(c1)
  nnnn0d(co(co(c1, caddc, nat1), cdiv, nat2), wa(wcel(c1, cn), wn(wbr(nat2, cdvds, c1))))
  biimpa(wcel(c1, cn), wn(wbr(nat2, cdvds, c1)), wcel(co(co(c1, caddc, nat1), cdiv, nat2), cn))
  nnoddm1d2(c1)
  nno(c1)
}

thm gausslemma2dlem0c(class c0, class c1, wff w0) {
  ⊢ (w0 →((! ` c0)[gcd]c1)= 1)
  ⊣ (w0 → c1 ∈(Prime \ { 2 }))
  ⊣ c0 =((c1[-]1)[÷]2)
} = {
  mpbird(w0, ((! ` c0)[gcd]c1)= 1, ¬ c1[||](! ` c0))
  sylc(w0, ¬ c1[||](! ` c0), (c1 ∈ Prime ∧ c0 ∈ ℕ0), c0[<]c1)
  jca(w0, c1 ∈ Prime, c0 ∈ ℕ0)
  syl5eqbr(c0, clt, c1, ((c1[-]1)[÷]2), w0)
  syl(w0, ((c1[-]1)[÷]2)[<]c1, c1 ∈(Prime \ { 2 }))
  3syl(c1 ∈(Prime \ { 2 }), ((c1[-]1)[÷]2)[<]c1, c1 ∈ Prime, c1 ∈ ℕ)
  mpbird(c1 ∈ ℕ, ((c1[-]1)[÷]2)[<]c1, (c1[-]1)[<](2[×]c1))
  ltletrd((c1[-]1), (2[×]c1), c1, c1 ∈ ℕ)
  remulcld(nat2, c1, c1 ∈ ℕ)
  ltm1d(c1, c1 ∈ ℕ)
  lemulge12d(c1, nat2, c1 ∈ ℕ)
  a1i(c1 ∈ ℕ, 2 ∈ ℝ)
  nn0ge0d(c1, c1 ∈ ℕ)
  nnnn0(c1)
  a1i(c1 ∈ ℕ, 1[≤]2)
  1le2()
  syl3anc(c1 ∈ ℕ, (((c1[-]1)[÷]2)[<]c1 ↔(c1[-]1)[<](2[×]c1)), (c1[-]1)∈ ℝ, c1 ∈ ℝ, (2 ∈ ℝ ∧ 0[<]2))
  syl(c1 ∈ ℕ, (c1[-]1)∈ ℝ, c1 ∈ ℝ)
  peano2rem(c1)
  nnre(c1)
  a1i(c1 ∈ ℕ, (2 ∈ ℝ ∧ 0[<]2))
  pm3.2i(2 ∈ ℝ, 0[<]2)
  2re()
  2pos()
  ltdivmul((c1[-]1), c1, nat2)
  prmndvdsfaclt(c1, c0)
  bitr4d(w0, ((! ` c0)[gcd]c1)= 1, ¬ c1[||](! ` c0), (c1[gcd](! ` c0))= 1)
  eqeq1d(((! ` c0)[gcd]c1), nat1, (c1[gcd](! ` c0)), w0)
  syl2anc(w0, ((! ` c0)[gcd]c1)=(c1[gcd](! ` c0)), (! ` c0)∈ ℤ, c1 ∈ ℤ)
  syl(w0, c1 ∈ ℤ, c1 ∈(Prime \ { 2 }))
  3syl(c1 ∈(Prime \ { 2 }), c1 ∈ ℤ, c1 ∈ Prime, c1 ∈ ℕ)
  prmnn(c1)
  nnz(c1)
  gcdcom((! ` c0), c1)
  syl2anc(w0, (¬ c1[||](! ` c0)↔(c1[gcd](! ` c0))= 1), c1 ∈ Prime, (! ` c0)∈ ℤ)
  syl(w0, c1 ∈ Prime, c1 ∈(Prime \ { 2 }))
  eldifi(c1, cprime, { 2 })
  nnzd((! ` c0), w0)
  faccld(c0, w0)
  nnnn0d(c0, w0)
  gausslemma2dlem0b(c0, c1, w0)
  coprm(c1, (! ` c0))
}

blocks.name: gausslemma2d
blocks.content: Gauss' Lemma (see also theorem 9.6 in [ApostolNT] p. 182) for integer ` 2 ` : Let p be an odd prime. Let S={2,4,6,...,(p-1)}. Let n denote the number of elements of S whose least positive residue modulo p is greater than p/2. Then ( 2 | p ) = (-1)^n. (Contributed by AV, 14-Jul-2021.)
